comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: No "Henion" in the NYT for 1913. But Hennion is the name of the Prefect of Police in Paris. Could this be him? Some of the photos in www.prefecture-police-paris.interieur.gouv.fr/documentati... look as though they could be him. And one is in a similar office. His predecessor, Lepine, resigned in March 1913. Hennion was mentioned in the NYT on April 20, 1913 when Isadora Duncan's children were drowned in Paris -- in a car that ran away when the chauffeur got out without turning the car off. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F03E2D81139E633A... His March 1915 obituary was in the NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A0CE0DC153AE633A...

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content:
The painting in your first link certainly looks like the same guy in the same office -- down to the strange contraption to the left of his desk.  And:  he's wearing a shirt with French cuffs!

I think you have him.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: And I've just noticed that the lectern behind him in this picture appears in the painted portrait in the first link too.  Also more of the contraption with keys is visible.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Swang: I agree with you and rjones0856 that the photo shows Celestin Hennion the Prefect of Police of Paris. Thank you for the interesting link showing the portrait of him in his office that closely resembles the one in the Bain image. Another image of Hennion is found at the Biblioteque National de France: gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b6929531g We will add his correct name to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Célestin Hennion CVO (8 September 1862 - 14 March 1915) was a French police officer who rose to head the Prefecture of Police (French: Préfecture de Police). He is notable for his reorganisation of the Préfecture and the introduction of the Tiger's Brigades (French: Brigades du Tigre). In France, he is considered the father of modern policing. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celestin_Hennion
